references.paper_title: Boltzmann generators: Sampling equilibrium states of many-body systems with deep learning
references.reason: This paper introduces Boltzmann Generators, a core methodology that the current work builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Timewarp: Transferable acceleration of molecular dynamics by learning time-coarsened dynamics
references.reason: This paper introduces the Timewarp model, a key comparative method for the current work, highlighting the transferable nature of sampling methods.

This paper introduces a framework for Boltzmann Generators in Cartesian coordinates using flow matching, which directly informs the architecture of the transferable Boltzmann Generators proposed here.
This paper presents flow matching, a training technique used to train the continuous normalizing flows that form the core of the Boltzmann generator model.
This paper details equivariant normalizing flows, a crucial element enabling the transferability of the Boltzmann Generators to unseen molecules.
